name: Election of Shrewsbury Conservatives
obverse: A crown rests on a bible sitting on top of a scepter and sword on top of a pillow. Surrounding this is a laurel branch with each leaf containing a name of one of the conservatives.
obverse_inscriptions: FESTIVAL OF SHREWSBURY TO CELEBRATE THE RETURN TO PARLIAMENT OF THE XII CONSERVATIVE MEMBERS FOR SHROPSHIRE
FORESTER, WHITMORE, ACKERS, TOMLINE, DARLINGTON, HILL, GORE, CLIVE, D’ISRAELI, BOTFIELD, PICOT, GASKELL
reverse: Shrewsbury Abbey, Lord Hill Column, and the English Bridge with the Wrekin in the distance.
references: Transactions of the Shropshire Archaeological and Natural History Society vol. 21
description: Struck to commemorate the meeting held at Shrewsbury to celebrate the return to Parliament of the 12 Conservative members for Shropshire on November 12, 1841.
